links.title: TSMC's Q1 profit up 45%, beats market estimates
links.description: Taiwan chip company TSMC posted a 45% surge in quarterly net profit on Thursday, Reuters calculations showed, boosted by a semiconductor boom from people splurging on devices during the pandemic that led to a supply shortage of chips.

message.body:
$SPY $DJIA $QQQ $AAPL $TSLA  
 
The best thing for America right now is for the FED to continue to allow inflation and asset prices to rip higher together 
  
This way the poor pay maximum amount of their paycheck to the wealthy and feel the most pain possible in relative terms.  
 
Then maybe people will begin to wake up...maybe.

$AAPL Citi expects Apple to announce an incremental stock repurchase program of $80 billion to $90 billion when the iPhone maker reports earnings on April 28. The company may also raise its dividend by 5% to 10%, Suva said.
A new buyback program would come on the heels of $81 billion deployed in repurchases across the last 12 months. Apple reported more than $37 billion in cash or cash equivalents as of the end of 2021.

links.title: Chinese carriers are shipping more empty containers than full ones out of U.S. West Coast ports
links.description: Two Chinese carriers are shipping more empty export containers than loaded exports out of the two biggest ports in the United States, according to CNBC analysis of exclusive trade data. CNBC analyzed the container data for 2020 and 2021 from the Port of Los Angeles, Port of Long Beach, U.S.
